input.project_name: UPM-2779719 - 505 Bayview Dr - Barrie (CLDC) - Chiller #2 Harmonic Filter Board Replacement
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):rejected by Sebastian Vandervort (3):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Chiller #2 Harmonic Filter alarmed on high total distortion. It was found that L1 and L2 were measuring 707 Amps and should be at zero while off. The filter board is not receiving the signal from the chiller and as suck is locking out. The filter board needs to be replaced to correct the issue and will be tested. The filter is now disabled and chiller #2 will only run in case of an emergency until this issue is resolved.
scope_of_work.scope: Ainsworth to replace the harmonic filter board on chiller #2. The chiller will be electrically isolated for this and will be restored and tested upon replacement of the filter board.
scope_of_work.justification: Required to run the chiller and for it to not shut down on high harmonic distortion. It will also maintain N+1 Redundancy as well as reliability of the standby chiller.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Inability to maintain N+1 redundancy and reliability

output.project_scope:

Problem identified: lost power to one side of the cabinet, breaker looks good, need to replace pdu. Scope includes: DH2 Turn off breaker on PDU B17 Pnl 5 25-27-29, disconnect and remove cabinet pdu, install and connect new cabinet pdu (provided). Turn breaker back on. Must work with the customer. Justification: cabinet is now only running on a single power bar. Effect if not approved: risk customer outage.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Maureen Gerlach (2):work order closed by Maureen Gerlach (3):work planning by Maureen Gerlach (4):offer approved by Maureen Gerlach (5):offer submitted by Maureen Gerlach

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The Generators 1 to 5 are due for a Tri-Annual maintenance as recommended by manufacturer original equipment.
scope_of_work.scope:
Generators 1,2,3,4,5
Total Cooling System ( Hose and Gaskets)
Total Belts Replacement
Total PLC batteries replacement
This includes the replacement of hoses, Thermostats and gaskets, a rinsing, as well as the replacement of the engine coolant
scope_of_work.justification: Orginal Equipment Manufacturer highly recommends Tri-Annual maintenance to be performed on the Generators to ensure reliabilty and longevity.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Generator Systems will not be within manufacturer's recommendations and could lead to failures.

input.project_name: UPM-2779976 - 245 Consumers Road Toronto - Cleanup Algoma account, exit from DC
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):work planning by Sebastian Vandervort (3):offer approved by Sebastian Vandervort (4):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
The following circuits related Algoma Racks K8, K7 and K6 need to be powered down, disconnected from the power bars and the whips cut and boxed closest to the RPP or PDU location after September 1st, 2022, as follows:

Power whips at Cabinet K8 (X023Y034):
PDU 12/2 #24/26
PDU 8/4 #37/39
RPP-2-1-A2-1A #16/18
RPP-2-1-B2-1A #16/18

Power whips at Cabinet K7 (X023Y032):
RPP-2-1-A2-1A #8/10
RPP-2-1-B2-1A #8/10
PDU 15/2 #9
RPP-2-1-A2-1A #12/14
RPP-2-1-B2-1A #12/14

Power whips at Cabinet K6 (X023Y031):
RPP-2-1-A2-1A #20/22
RPP-2-1-B2-1A #20/22

Purchase of eight (8) wood core tiles, full face, and replacement of existing perforated tiles after the removal of hardware.
scope_of_work.scope:
-De-energize the above circuits
-Cut off the whips the closest location to the PDU
-Box the end of the whips
-Purchase of eight (8) wood core tiles, full face, and replacement of existing perforated tiles after the removal of hardware
scope_of_work.justification: Algoma account will leave DC before September 1st, 2022 and floor has to be returned to the original state, ready for use.
